title: Croatia Takes a Step Toward Returning Art Looted During the Holocaust
description: A study released jointly by the government and the World Jewish Restitution Organization details the plunder from Jewish estates and lists some of the works still held in Croatian museums.
dc:creator: Catherine Hickley
category: Commission for the Preservation of Cultural Monuments (KOMZA)
media:description: A report on the art taken from Jews in what is now Croatia during the Holocaust is viewed as a step toward the return of some works to heirs. Some art went to the Strossmayer Gallery of Old Masters in Zagreb.
